str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
Supplication, prayer, entreaty. From deomai; a petition.
And, even, also, namely.
From a derivative of the base of hikanos; intreaty.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.
(a) a shout, cry, clamor, (b) outcry, clamoring against another. From krazo; an outcry.
And, even, also, namely.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hear, listen to, heed. From eis and akouo; to listen to.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Reverence, fear of God, piety. From eulabes; properly, caution, i.e. reverence; by implication, dread.
